subject: compute: restart OVS agent on neutron.conf changes
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-29 19:28:06.000000000', 'files': ['puppet/manifests/overcloud_compute.pp'], 'message': "compute: restart OVS agent on neutron.conf changes

Some options in neutron.conf are used bu OVS agent, like logging &
messaging.
During the upgrade process, you need to restart the agent if these
options change.

We could patch puppet-neutron to add a notify, but the community won't
like it because Neutron OVS agent is not able to restart gracefully
until [1] got merged. Until that, we can fix it in TripleO, where we
suppose Puppet runs happenning during bootstraps and upgrades.

Later, we'll drop this code from here and move it in puppet-neutron.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/297211

Change-Id: I02b17b66e93331ddfb1a7abd8adff672bc7a32d6
Closes-Bug: #1563437
"}]
commit_message:
compute: restart OVS agent on neutron.conf changes

Some options in neutron.conf are used bu OVS agent, like logging &
messaging.
During the upgrade process, you need to restart the agent if these
options change.

We could patch puppet-neutron to add a notify, but the community won't
like it because Neutron OVS agent is not able to restart gracefully
until [1] got merged. Until that, we can fix it in TripleO, where we
suppose Puppet runs happenning during bootstraps and upgrades.

Later, we'll drop this code from here and move it in puppet-neutron.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/297211

Change-Id: I02b17b66e93331ddfb1a7abd8adff672bc7a32d6
Closes-Bug: #1563437

subject: cinder-backup service should be optional
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-03-30 08:44:57.000000000', 'files': ['unit_tests/test_cinder_utils.py', 'hooks/cinder_utils.py'], 'message': 'cinder-backup service should be optional

The charm has cinder-backup listed as a core service which should always be
restarted on changes to config. However, cinder-backup is only present if
installed by the cinder-backup subordinate charm. The new pause/resume code
will put the charm in a blocked state in this case so it needs fixing.

This charm was not using some of the openstack charm conventions such as using
register_configs with resource_map and using hook_context rather context as
the key in resource map dict. These have been fixed.

Closes-Bug: 1563340
Change-Id: I2fd46e96e60dd60462a4ffa89f7f84e9fd31d234
'}]
commit_message:
cinder-backup service should be optional

The charm has cinder-backup listed as a core service which should always be
restarted on changes to config. However, cinder-backup is only present if
installed by the cinder-backup subordinate charm. The new pause/resume code
will put the charm in a blocked state in this case so it needs fixing.

This charm was not using some of the openstack charm conventions such as using
register_configs with resource_map and using hook_context rather context as
the key in resource map dict. These have been fixed.

Closes-Bug: 1563340
Change-Id: I2fd46e96e60dd60462a4ffa89f7f84e9fd31d234

subject: Added precheck to check kernel version 4.2 on Ubuntu 14.04.
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-03-30 04:15:16.000000000', 'files': ['ansible/roles/prechecks/tasks/package_checks.yml', 'ansible/roles/prechecks/vars/main.yml'], 'message': 'Added precheck to check kernel version 4.2 on Ubuntu 14.04.

Kolla recommends LTS wily kernel version 4.2 on Ubuntu 14.04.

http://docs.openstack.org/developer/kolla/quickstart.html#installing-dependencies

The precheck check the running kernel version, because checking
the linux-image-generic-lts-wily cannot be a valid check.

The package (linux-image-generic-lts-wily) can be installed, but
the running kernel can be other version.

Closes-Bug: #1563500
Co-Authored-By: Vikram Hosakote <vhosakot@cisco.com>
Change-Id: I4e08bca95493b2dbd0ad5f8d1ea4e07b18c4959d
'}]
commit_message:
Added precheck to check kernel version 4.2 on Ubuntu 14.04.

Kolla recommends LTS wily kernel version 4.2 on Ubuntu 14.04.

http://docs.openstack.org/developer/kolla/quickstart.html#installing-dependencies

The precheck check the running kernel version, because checking
the linux-image-generic-lts-wily cannot be a valid check.

The package (linux-image-generic-lts-wily) can be installed, but
the running kernel can be other version.

Closes-Bug: #1563500
Co-Authored-By: Vikram Hosakote <vhosakot@cisco.com>
Change-Id: I4e08bca95493b2dbd0ad5f8d1ea4e07b18c4959d

commit_message:
Cover case, when re.search returns None

 Remove methods duplication (execute_on remote is already implements stdout joining)
 Switch to SshManager at test

Closes-bug: #1558513

subject: Cleaning test DB without Alembic migrations
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 8392, 'name': 'Aleksey Kasatkin', 'email': 'akasatkin@mirantis.com', 'username': 'aleksey'}, {'_account_id': 8931, 'name': 'Artem Roma', 'email': 'aroma@mirantis.com', 'username': 'aateem'}, {'_account_id': 8971, 'name': 'Fuel CI', 'username': 'fuel-ci', 'inactive': True, 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10959, 'name': 'Alexander Kislitsky', 'email': 'akislitsky@mirantis.com', 'username': 'akislitsky'}, {'_account_id': 12661, 'name': 'Dmitry Guryanov', 'email': 'dmitry.guryanov@gmail.com', 'username': 'dguryanov'}, {'_account_id': 18205, 'name': 'Bulat Gaifullin', 'email': 'gaifullinbf@gmail.com', 'username': 'bgaifullin'}, {'_account_id': 21013, 'name': 'Georgy Kibardin', 'email': 'gkibardin@mirantis.com', 'username': 'gkibardin'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-03-29 14:23:13.000000000', 'files': ['collector/collector/test/db/test_migration.py', 'collector/collector/test/base.py'], 'message': 'Cleaning test DB without Alembic migrations

On the Fuel CI we have no rights to drop and create DB.
In the tests we are downgrading and upgrading DB schema by Alembic
migrations. In case of adding migrations in one review we had
all other reviews broken due to Alembic failures on attempt to
downgrade DB schema.
As fix we are fallback to the cleaning DB without migrations
in case of Alembic error on the schema downgrade.

Change-Id: I65faf43c28427594495c67696ca190e7fe29f083
Closes-Bug: #1556876
'}]
commit_message:
Cleaning test DB without Alembic migrations

On the Fuel CI we have no rights to drop and create DB.
In the tests we are downgrading and upgrading DB schema by Alembic
migrations. In case of adding migrations in one review we had
all other reviews broken due to Alembic failures on attempt to
downgrade DB schema.
As fix we are fallback to the cleaning DB without migrations
in case of Alembic error on the schema downgrade.

Change-Id: I65faf43c28427594495c67696ca190e7fe29f083
Closes-Bug: #1556876

metadata.

Type of "metadata." parameter after modify: xsd:string

commit_message:
Compute API (CURRENT): Type of some parameters are wrong on "Create volume"

This patch modified type of some parameters: size, volume_type and
metadata.

Type of "size" parameter after modify: xsd:int
Type of "volume_type" parameter after modify: xsd:string
Type of "metadata." parameter after modify: xsd:string

And added a parameter: volume

Closes-Bug: #1563201
Change-Id: I6fe55e11f14d31bfde7e26710c24e3ee5e39b78e

commit_message:
Fix the "Type" column at the Volume types api's

The "Type" column of the "volume_type" in the request parameters is
described as "csapi:string" but correct value is "xsd:dict".

Change-Id: Ibfc4ee1d738d491ec6fb6e3a331dc0f52db496b8
Closes-Bug: #1563107

subject: Remove the migrated service client
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-25 23:04:28.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/services/network/json/security_group_rules_client.py', 'tempest/clients.py'], 'message': 'Remove the migrated service client

security_group_rules_client has been already migrated into tempest-lib
with the commit I76b1d0b1c3ffb2c366c4e6d95105d9c8fde2a22b . But we have
re-integrated tempest-lib into tempest. Then the client is duplicated now.
This patch makes clients.py use the new one and removes the old one.

Change-Id: I3a2e1f255c001b8dc60d44d24c3f6f92771f8944
'}]
commit_message:
Remove the migrated service client

security_group_rules_client has been already migrated into tempest-lib
with the commit I76b1d0b1c3ffb2c366c4e6d95105d9c8fde2a22b . But we have
re-integrated tempest-lib into tempest. Then the client is duplicated now.
This patch makes clients.py use the new one and removes the old one.

Change-Id: I3a2e1f255c001b8dc60d44d24c3f6f92771f8944

When starting up, we don't want to delete the patch port between br-int
and br-tun unless we're also dropping the flows..  In liberty both of
these bridges were switched to not dump flows on startup and to put the
bridges in secure mode so that default flood flows are not installed
when the bridge is created.

Without this patch the patch port is torn down and not reinstalled until
br-tun is setup again.

Partial-Bug: #1514056
Change-Id: Ia518a99a2de5d1bda467fde57892c43970f88bcd
"}]
commit_message:
Don't delete br-int to br-tun patch on startup

When starting up, we don't want to delete the patch port between br-int
and br-tun unless we're also dropping the flows..  In liberty both of
these bridges were switched to not dump flows on startup and to put the
bridges in secure mode so that default flood flows are not installed
when the bridge is created.

Without this patch the patch port is torn down and not reinstalled until
br-tun is setup again.

Partial-Bug: #1514056
Change-Id: Ia518a99a2de5d1bda467fde57892c43970f88bcd

commit_message:
Keep py3.X compatibility for urllib

urllib/urllib2 is incompatible for python 3
Use modules from six.moves.urllib instead of urllib
and urllib2

Change-Id: Ic9d8ce4e700d19053c67cf667e1d802bd1477108
Partial-Bug:#1280105

Change-Id: Id73bace93bfc2379e80777da7dc0c0bb059d6cd3

commit_message:
Add translation rule to delete ssh auth key from Magnum baymodel

Add a translation rule to ensure that users with existing templates will
not have them break when they update due to the 'ssh_authorized_key'
property having been removed from Magnum and hidden in Heat.

Change-Id: Id73bace93bfc2379e80777da7dc0c0bb059d6cd3
Related-Bug: #1560284
(cherry picked from commit 0ab68f891348eeafa1efa219070ef39f776cb6c6)

subject: Revert "Check RBAC policy for nested stacks"
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-03-30 07:31:14.000000000', 'files': ['heat/engine/stack.py', 'heat/common/policy.py', 'heat_integrationtests/functional/test_conditional_exposure.py'], 'message': 'Revert "Check RBAC policy for nested stacks"

This is causing issues with tripleo failures
with ValueError, when trying do stack-preview as
part of policy enforcement for stack DELETE.

This reverts commit a8accbba98b5fc15562864030f49d20570bf8412.

Change-Id: I366316f27f24c650bd435e67dd17abd8676cedf4
Closes-Bug: #1561172
'}]
commit_message:
Revert "Check RBAC policy for nested stacks"

This is causing issues with tripleo failures
with ValueError, when trying do stack-preview as
part of policy enforcement for stack DELETE.

This reverts commit a8accbba98b5fc15562864030f49d20570bf8412.

Change-Id: I366316f27f24c650bd435e67dd17abd8676cedf4
Closes-Bug: #1561172

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-25 00:03:41.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_requirements/cmds/update.py'], 'message': 'Fix use of a renamed itertools function in python3

In python3 izip functions got renamed to zip in itertools module.

Change-Id: I6fda87b78e40be134d7c94698cca5d85a51eb989

commit_message:
Fix use of a renamed itertools function in python3

In python3 izip functions got renamed to zip in itertools module.
This was breaking support for python3.

Change-Id: I6fda87b78e40be134d7c94698cca5d85a51eb989

- move device-specific configuration to separate modules/classes

commit_message:
Refactor device handling

- move device-specific configuration to separate modules/classes
- simplify GenericSwitch class methods, remove duplication
- clean up imports
- raise proper Neutron ml2 exceptions, these would be logged and
  re-raised in Neutron itself
- add oslo.utils to requirements
- move conf-related functions/methods to separate module

Change-Id: I922f3dc677c1e6ddec63cc7fe775764fbc2844d1

commit_message:
Use logger.exception when generating logs about exceptions

As the follow-up of I42adec07d980be22044a5d4ef6771318a3eed168,

With Ie35360de617d0bbb1fa55c0f10956e6e669dda8d we introduced the

subject: Do not upgrade packages with cloud-init
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-03-30 08:07:18.000000000', 'files': ['meta/io.murano/Resources/murano-init.conf', 'meta/io.murano/Resources/conflang.conf'], 'message': "Do not upgrade packages with cloud-init

This patch deletes 'package_upgrade: true' option from cloud-init confs.
It caused upgrading of all the packages in the images spawned by murano.
This made spawning VMs slow and in certain cases caused
dpkg locks be still in place when murano-agent attempted to
install packages

Change-Id: I440d2985f9122dad53c81b15148e60df4e7e9583
Closes-Bug: 1548857
"}]
commit_message:
Do not upgrade packages with cloud-init

This patch deletes 'package_upgrade: true' option from cloud-init confs.
It caused upgrading of all the packages in the images spawned by murano.
This made spawning VMs slow and in certain cases caused
dpkg locks be still in place when murano-agent attempted to
install packages

Change-Id: I440d2985f9122dad53c81b15148e60df4e7e9583
Closes-Bug: 1548857

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-03-29 21:45:02.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/api/extensions.py'], 'message': 'Support Routes==2.3

SubMapper.connect allows in Routes<=2.2 to define routes with/without a
name:

 map.connect(route_name, route_path)
 map.connect(route_path)

Routes==2.3 SubMapper.connect now requires a route name (but not
Mapper.connect). This change adds a route name when needed to support
Routes<=2.2 and Routes==2.3.

Closes-Bug: #1563028
Change-Id: I655bfe7f047945896d63dd94c584acfe60d81b38
'}]
commit_message:
Support Routes==2.3

SubMapper.connect allows in Routes<=2.2 to define routes with/without a
name:

 map.connect(route_name, route_path)
 map.connect(route_path)

Routes==2.3 SubMapper.connect now requires a route name (but not
Mapper.connect). This change adds a route name when needed to support
Routes<=2.2 and Routes==2.3.

Closes-Bug: #1563028
Change-Id: I655bfe7f047945896d63dd94c584acfe60d81b38

commit_message:
Explicitly set resource dependencies for ceph osd prepare

Despite explicit class relationships, this particular resource
occasioanly is executed earlier that is should be.

Change-Id: I180230552f4f8f94d6faf94be5a84566add714d7

commit_message:
Move implemented mitaka specs

Note that resource-classes was already moved but the redirects
file wasn't updated, that's fixed here.

There are some partial blueprints that were marked completed in
mitaka and are still being worked in newton, like the config
option work. I've moved those to implemented here also.

subject: Remove sbcl from bindep-fallback.txt
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-03-29 08:03:03.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/data/bindep-fallback.txt'], 'message': 'Remove sbcl from bindep-fallback.txt

The sbcl (common lisp) package is only needed by cl-openstack-client.
That repo now has an other-requirements.txt file, so we do not need
to install sbcl for every project and thus can remove it from
bindep-fallback.txt.

Note that cl-openstack-client does not work currently with sbcl at all,
so we cannot merge the related change at the moment.

Related change: Ie1ecb184bd825aea4dbb315cf125b991ae22d682

Change-Id: If8b4e412f8ae48c6c0133634df4a95d10a876be3
'}]
commit_message:
Remove sbcl from bindep-fallback.txt

The sbcl (common lisp) package is only needed by cl-openstack-client.
That repo now has an other-requirements.txt file, so we do not need
to install sbcl for every project and thus can remove it from
bindep-fallback.txt.

Note that cl-openstack-client does not work currently with sbcl at all,
so we cannot merge the related change at the moment.

Related change: Ie1ecb184bd825aea4dbb315cf125b991ae22d682

Change-Id: If8b4e412f8ae48c6c0133634df4a95d10a876be3

commit_message:
Run bindep on project-config only if needed

Run the bindep fallback jobs on project-config only if the bindep
fallback list has changed.

We first have to duplicate the job so that we can limit the
project-config version of it.

Change-Id: I3a15946994b21850fd491b21190a50b7da415896

commit_message:
DHCP: Downgrade 'network has been deleted' logs

These will happen all of the time as networks are quickly
created/updated and then deleted. It's not any kind of
actionable warning condition so this patch downgrades them
to debug.

Conflicts:
	neutron/agent/dhcp/agent.py
	neutron/tests/unit/agent/dhcp/test_agent.py

Change-Id: Idcfb185b9a0540c13101dceb3681132f38f1716c
Closes-Bug: #1555842
(cherry picked from commit 72e9fc900183abb39e0687b4fa4a4a277f21152e)

commit_message:
Duplicate help message in metadata tab

When launching an instance or updating the metadata of an image,
there is a duplicate help text on the top and the bottom of the
metadata tab.
This patch will change the text on the bottom by a meaningful
message to avoid the repetition.

Change-Id: Idc41db67edaa5bb2921daf958d1e7bf8a07aa648
Closes-Bug: #1558002
Closes-Bug: #1563137

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-03-15 18:01:49.000000000', 'files': ['iso/ks.template'], 'message': 'Fuel master deployment fails due to disk size

From IRC, it has been reported that the 45gb messaged
 as part of the master install is not sufficient enough
to deploy 8.0 with docker containers.
The documentation specifies that the minimum size should
be 50gb
https://docs.mirantis.com/openstack/fuel/fuel-8.0/fuel-install-guide.html#

This patch will resolve this issue, will set the minimum
disk size requirement to 50gb and will change the related
error message.

Closes-Bug: #1557628

Change-Id: I634c42d2a8420a3ea35ce3fdae54ab499e9ea154
'}]
commit_message:
Fuel master deployment fails due to disk size

From IRC, it has been reported that the 45gb messaged
 as part of the master install is not sufficient enough
to deploy 8.0 with docker containers.
The documentation specifies that the minimum size should
be 50gb
https://docs.mirantis.com/openstack/fuel/fuel-8.0/fuel-install-guide.html#

This patch will resolve this issue, will set the minimum
disk size requirement to 50gb and will change the related
error message.

Closes-Bug: #1557628

Change-Id: I634c42d2a8420a3ea35ce3fdae54ab499e9ea154

subject: Check if /var/lib/ceph/nss exists before creation
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-03-30 08:11:05.000000000', 'files': ['hooks/hooks.py'], 'message': "Check if /var/lib/ceph/nss exists before creation

mkdir() throws an exception if the directory already exists, so we should check
for it's existance before creation as hooks should be idempotent.

This occurred in practice when the install hook had to be re-run, following a
previous failure due to juju API timeout.  It would also occur if the keystone
relation was re-built, so that case is also fixed.

Change-Id: I4052cda5bb20f76ab592ed7817bdc1e5b5b2138d
Closes-Bug: #1563667
"}]
commit_message:
Check if /var/lib/ceph/nss exists before creation

mkdir() throws an exception if the directory already exists, so we should check
for it's existance before creation as hooks should be idempotent.

This occurred in practice when the install hook had to be re-run, following a
previous failure due to juju API timeout.  It would also occur if the keystone
relation was re-built, so that case is also fixed.

Change-Id: I4052cda5bb20f76ab592ed7817bdc1e5b5b2138d
Closes-Bug: #1563667

Use the python db jobs. These run the same tests as the normal jobs,
just setup databases. This is in preparation for a future cleanup of
the default python jobs so that they those not run databases by default.
These repo need databases setup for tests.

Change-Id: Ib06c9c94cb767e790d6420093244d722a1b1eda3

commit_message:
fuel-stats: use db setup for python jobs

Use the python db jobs. These run the same tests as the normal jobs,
just setup databases. This is in preparation for a future cleanup of
the default python jobs so that they those not run databases by default.
These repo need databases setup for tests.

Change-Id: Ib06c9c94cb767e790d6420093244d722a1b1eda3

commit_message:
Add hardening support

Add charmhelpers.contrib.hardening and calls to install,
config-changed, upgrade-charm and update-status hooks.
Also add new config option to allow one or more hardening
modules to be applied at runtime.

Change-Id: I7e6abb16d16d08575cad4f3a52b6fc54b3ac01c2

commit_message:
Add hardening support

Add charmhelpers.contrib.hardening and calls to install,
config-changed, upgrade-charm and update-status hooks. Also
add new config option to allow one or more hardening
modules to be applied at runtime.

Change-Id: I5f85699adcb5c37ffcda971a3ed5f1f965fd7fb6

commit_message:
Add hardening support

Add charmhelpers.contrib.hardening and calls to install,
config-changed, upgrade-charm and update-status hooks. Also
add new config option to allow one or more hardening
modules to be applied at runtime.

Change-Id: I59afd73eace559f17f8a905da3c5d441942b6e95

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-03-28 10:14:42.000000000', 'files': ['deployment/puppet/osnailyfacter/templates/openrc.erb'], 'message': 'Don't override LC_ALL

In Ubuntu (14.04) LC_ALL is not set by default,
other variables are set with UTF-8. Such combi-
nation of settings is valid for working with
non-ASCII characters.
Setting LC_ALL to "C" will override all other
LC_* settings and force ASCII usage. This obstructs
the work with Unicode variables in OSC arguments
(e.g. command 'glance image-create --name 試験画像'
will fail)
As OS works with UTF-8, so we shouldn't hinder.

Change-Id: I9ba428ac4e70cf7d7309054ccb63a46d496a8b4c
Closes-bug: #1543102
'}]
commit_message:
Don't override LC_ALL

In Ubuntu (14.04) LC_ALL is not set by default,
other variables are set with UTF-8. Such combi-
nation of settings is valid for working with
non-ASCII characters.
Setting LC_ALL to "C" will override all other
LC_* settings and force ASCII usage. This obstructs
the work with Unicode variables in OSC arguments
(e.g. command 'glance image-create --name 試験画像'
will fail)
As OS works with UTF-8, so we shouldn't hinder.

Change-Id: I9ba428ac4e70cf7d7309054ccb63a46d496a8b4c
Closes-bug: #1543102

commit_message:
Merge rabbitmq default config vars w/ custom ones

Merge all sources of rabbitmq config variables in order to
avoid the default settings loss in case when custom config
options come from hiera.

Change-Id: I572bd72b6c9571a49deec9ee683f8e0d76bed9ae
Related-Bug: #1560687

commit_message:
Add Liberty template with keystone v3 support

This change adds a template for liberty or above that works with a keystone
v3 endpoint. It also removes the Mitaka template as it duplicated the liberty
one.

Change-Id: Ic0bd24c8516b541c44dac9c8a92357050e75fcf6
Partial-Bug: 1522397

Get config_drive_format option

or "vfat" (default for live migration function).

commit_message:
Add hardening support

Add charmhelpers.contrib.hardening and calls to install,
config-changed, upgrade-charm and update-status hooks. Also
add new config option to allow one or more hardening
modules to be applied at runtime.

Change-Id: I3009f6f20d9e3524d5396b9828610e6586692827

Add hardening support

Add charmhelpers.contrib.hardening and calls to install,
config-changed, upgrade-charm and update-status hooks.
Also add new config option to allow one or more hardening
modules to be applied at runtime.

Change-Id: I525c15a14662175f2a68cdcd25a3ab2c92237850

commit_message:
Add hardening support

Add charmhelpers.contrib.hardening and calls to install,
config-changed, upgrade-charm and update-status hooks. Also
add new config option to allow one or more hardening
modules to be applied at runtime.

Change-Id: I7f5b2f6f271829c696a496319d64f575d0da1e26

charm stays paused during maintenance operations.

charm stays paused during maintenance operations.

Add charmhelpers.contrib.hardening and calls to install,
config-changed, upgrade-charm and update-status hooks.
Also add new config option to allow one or more hardening
modules to be applied at runtime.

commit_message:
Deploy ceph in the nonha job

The ceph job has been renamed to "upgrades", to continue testing
ceph support we need to add it to the nonha job. There is another
patch Ic0196596df6a11b02333d06f63b2e13c137c0bcc that is going to
be adding upgrades support to toci.

As is, this patch essentially will leave the upgrades job to a nonha
job without ceph.

Depends-On: I6110b71e484af749838f91dc5c6c4982b0c83074
Change-Id: I508610432efcbcf88f065a01f20b805adf7ce912

commit_message:
Add hardening support

Add charmhelpers.contrib.hardening and calls to install,
config-changed, upgrade-charm and update-status hooks. Also
add new config option to allow one or more hardening
modules to be applied at runtime.

Change-Id: Ic417d678d3b0f7bfda5b393628a67297d7e79107

commit_message:
Add hardening support

Add charmhelpers.contrib.hardening and calls to install,
config-changed, upgrade-charm and update-status hooks.
Also add new config option to allow one or more hardening
modules to be applied at runtime.

Change-Id: If0d1e10b58ed506e0aca659f30120b8d5c96c04f

add new config option to allow one or more hardening
modules to be applied at runtime.

With the Mitaka release multiple changes have been made to the
Manila driver:

    - IP and user access rules changes for both NFS and CIFS shares.

commit_message:
Update HPE 3PAR Shared File System Docs

With the Mitaka release multiple changes have been made to the
Manila driver:
    - Access rules changes for both NFS and CIFS shares.
    - IP and user access rules changes for both NFS and CIFS shares.
    - Client version bump.
    - Deleting of file tree for nested shares.

Change-Id: Iee4df6c200f943dabc0ae3cea7184d4c1ae03153

[{'number': 33, 'created': '2016-03-02 19:08:28.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/unit/db/test_bgp_db.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/db/test_db_base_plugin_v2.py', 'neutron/tests/api/test_bgp_speaker_extensions_negative.py', 'neutron/extensions/bgp.py', 'neutron/tests/api/test_bgp_speaker_extensions.py', 'neutron/tests/tempest/services/network/json/network_client.py', 'neutron/db/bgp_db.py'], 'message': "Add Queries For BGP Route Lookups

This patch contains code for looking in the Neutron DB and identifying
next-hops for tenant networks and floating IP's. These queries use the
centralized router as the next-hop and ignore host routes attached to
a distributed router.

Partially-Implements: blueprint bgp-dynamic-routing
Co-Authored-By: vikram.choudhary <vikram.choudhary@huawei.com>
Change-Id: If08d6595d9bc657a7ecfb487e8df40860837d200
"}]
commit_message:
Add Queries For BGP Route Lookups

This patch contains code for looking in the Neutron DB and identifying
next-hops for tenant networks and floating IP's. These queries use the
centralized router as the next-hop and ignore host routes attached to
a distributed router.

Partially-Implements: blueprint bgp-dynamic-routing
Co-Authored-By: vikram.choudhary <vikram.choudhary@huawei.com>
Change-Id: If08d6595d9bc657a7ecfb487e8df40860837d200

subject: devstack-plugin-nfs: Make tempest non-voting
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-03-29 18:51:13.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/projects.yaml', 'zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': "devstack-plugin-nfs: Make tempest non-voting

This is to resolve a chicken/egg problem with
this plugin.  The NFS code in Cinder is not yet in shape
to pass all tempest tests, and I'd like to use this
plugin to vet that code while it's in-progress with a
non-voting Cinder job.

So, allow commits to the plugin for now until everything
is up and running, and then this job can be made voting
again.

Change-Id: Ia01d37951d4ba49da6a55e90d8379f3a29e6975c
"}]
commit_message:
devstack-plugin-nfs: Make tempest non-voting

This is to resolve a chicken/egg problem with
this plugin.  The NFS code in Cinder is not yet in shape
to pass all tempest tests, and I'd like to use this
plugin to vet that code while it's in-progress with a
non-voting Cinder job.

So, allow commits to the plugin for now until everything
is up and running, and then this job can be made voting
again.

Change-Id: Ia01d37951d4ba49da6a55e90d8379f3a29e6975c

commit_message:
Remove oslo.messaging from bandit integration

This patch temporarily removes oslo.messaging from the bandit
integration until that project has bandit passing as part of its
gate. The reference patch for this is:
    https://review.openstack.org/#/c/286506/

In this way, we can proceed with a new release of bandit since
all other integrations are passing.

Change-Id: I13076dd36f8b0b584d5289c217105d0bd75207f2

commit_message:
Conveyor focuses on cloning and migrating Openstack resources.

Conveyor can clone and migrate resources between independent DC
or host/availability zone in the same DC, this can be triggered
by admin or resource owner, the resource types of
resources include Instance, Volume, Network, Router, Loadbalance, Stack.

commit_message:
Move verification about storlet upload from gateway to middleware

Now, we have verifyStorletUpload under gateway module, but it
includes swift-specific implementations.
This patch removes swift-specific implementation about that
verification, and make gateway interface more generic.

Change-Id: Ia04e9b7b947df93faf2be676a934259f9537118c

subject: ceph: Allow to change the image path
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-28 14:59:23.000000000', 'files': ['lib/ceph'], 'message': "ceph: Allow to change the image path

If we want to put the disk image into a tmpfs, changing CEPH_DATA_DIR
won't work because some file operation needed by ceph are not allowed
on tmpfs.

So, this change allows to change the disk image path only instead of the
whole CEPH_DATA_DIR.

Change-Id: If92f0bdca16f866a475820cf71a30ded28fb2572
"}]
commit_message:
ceph: Allow to change the image path

If we want to put the disk image into a tmpfs, changing CEPH_DATA_DIR
won't work because some file operation needed by ceph are not allowed
on tmpfs.

So, this change allows to change the disk image path only instead of the
whole CEPH_DATA_DIR.

Change-Id: If92f0bdca16f866a475820cf71a30ded28fb2572

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-28 14:59:23.000000000', 'files': ['lib/ceph'], 'message': 'ceph: fix setup with version >= infernalis

Since infernalis, a ceph user is created and daemon
run as ceph user.

This change allows devstack to work with ceph version
>= infernalis without breaking it with < hammer.

Change-Id: Ibd2d7c10a7caaa75ced078dac027d3af5f96b52c

commit_message:
ceph: fix setup with version >= infernalis

Since infernalis, a ceph user is created and daemon
run as ceph user.

This change allows devstack to work with ceph version
>= infernalis without breaking it with < hammer.

Change-Id: Ibd2d7c10a7caaa75ced078dac027d3af5f96b52c

subject: Sync ACLs between Neutron and NB database
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1561, 'name': 'Russell Bryant', 'email': 'rbryant@redhat.com', 'username': 'russellb'}, {'_account_id': 4395, 'name': 'Aaron Rosen', 'email': 'aaronorosen@gmail.com', 'username': 'arosen'}, {'_account_id': 10068, 'name': 'Welcome, new contributor!', 'username': 'welcome-message'}, {'_account_id': 11343, 'name': 'Gal Sagie', 'email': 'gal.sagie@gmail.com', 'username': 'GalSagie'}, {'_account_id': 18589, 'name': 'Chandra Sekhar Vejendla', 'email': 'csvejend@us.ibm.com', 'username': 'chandrav'}, {'_account_id': 19728, 'name': 'Nirapada Ghosh', 'email': 'nghosh@us.ibm.com', 'username': 'nirapada'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-03-25 04:25:09.000000000', 'files': ['networking_ovn/tests/unit/test_ovn_nb_sync.py', 'networking_ovn/ovn_nb_sync.py', 'networking_ovn/cmd/neutron_ovn_db_sync_util.py'], 'message': 'Sync ACLs between Neutron and NB database

This patch modifies the existing ovn db sync tool to add
syncing of ACLS between neutron and NB database. It reads
the neutron DB, generates all the ACLs, reads the OVN NB
ACL list, compares them, adds the missing ones into NB
database and deletes the ones found in OVN northbound DB
but not found in neutron.

Related-bug: 1546315

Change-Id: Iacfec2260baa1b3fa026acd173a0bfe7709fc8d8
'}]
commit_message:
Sync ACLs between Neutron and NB database

This patch modifies the existing ovn db sync tool to add
syncing of ACLS between neutron and NB database. It reads
the neutron DB, generates all the ACLs, reads the OVN NB
ACL list, compares them, adds the missing ones into NB
database and deletes the ones found in OVN northbound DB
but not found in neutron.

Related-bug: 1546315

Change-Id: Iacfec2260baa1b3fa026acd173a0bfe7709fc8d8

commit_message:
Adds a PostPuppetConfig for restart of neutron-openvswitch-agent

After running an upgrade to completion there is a problem with the
neutron-openvswitch-agent on compute nodes. It doesn't get
restarted and so doesn't pickup any neutron.conf change.
For upgrades we are changing the rabbit password and so the agent
can not talk to rabbit with the new password until it gets
restarted.

Closes-Bug: 1563437
Change-Id: I020a98b620f2388ce69b7b00711476bb96d0c46b

commit_message:
OVSDB monitor to filter port update events

OVSDB monitor should only dispatch events for ports that are attached to
the br-int bridge. The controller need not be notified of other ports.

Change-Id: I2ef8a1a55a07f48f1a81852b3fb52fcfae99b49f
Closes-Bug: 1561517

commit_message:
Graph model describing virtual and physical elements in a data center

To support a rich set of graph analysis methods during strategy determination we want to have a simple graph model. The graph model should describe how VMs are associated to compute hosts, how virtual networks entities are mapped to physical networks devices, objects/block storage objects to physical storage devices.

Change-Id: I1c57a3b9f95670b02ebe91a6647e8aba0bcfb8fc
Implements: blueprint graph-based-cluster-model

subject: Fix host-evacuate-live for 2.25 microversion
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-29 21:17:00.000000000', 'files': ['novaclient/v2/contrib/host_evacuate_live.py', 'novaclient/tests/unit/v2/test_shell.py'], 'message': "Fix host-evacuate-live for 2.25 microversion

Change I01b22593724616bc0a7793c509ecabf095d6927d made the
live_migrate() method in the ServerManager conditional on the
API version requested. This broke the host-evacuate-live
command which is calling ServerManager.live_migrate() directly
with one too many arguments for the v2.25 version of the method.

This updates the host-evacuate-live shell to behave like the

NOTE(mriedem): The conflict is due to
93913c84b67d3aefe79bef106fbe9a83f0bcdb71 not being in stable/mitaka.
Also note that this is not for a blueprint, it's just related
to a blueprint that landed in mitaka but introduced a regression
here when support was added for that blueprint with the 2.25
microversion.

Change-Id: I4dbeb6ebe03f03799b706be2d787d21484b5c664
Closes-Bug: #1561938
(cherry picked from commit 90fbbb29562a905e8f70badf2c31cfb4ec6841ed)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix host-evacuate-live for 2.25 microversion

Change I01b22593724616bc0a7793c509ecabf095d6927d made the
live_migrate() method in the ServerManager conditional on the
API version requested. This broke the host-evacuate-live
command which is calling ServerManager.live_migrate() directly
with one too many arguments for the v2.25 version of the method.

This updates the host-evacuate-live shell to behave like the
live-migration method and be aware of the API version when
calling the live_migrate() method.

Related to blueprint making-live-migration-api-friendly

Conflicts:
        novaclient/v2/contrib/host_evacuate_live.py

NOTE(mriedem): The conflict is due to
93913c84b67d3aefe79bef106fbe9a83f0bcdb71 not being in stable/mitaka.
Also note that this is not for a blueprint, it's just related
to a blueprint that landed in mitaka but introduced a regression
here when support was added for that blueprint with the 2.25
microversion.

Change-Id: I4dbeb6ebe03f03799b706be2d787d21484b5c664
Closes-Bug: #1561938
(cherry picked from commit 90fbbb29562a905e8f70badf2c31cfb4ec6841ed)

subject: Start ovn-northd in the devstack screen as a foreground process
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1561, 'name': 'Russell Bryant', 'email': 'rbryant@redhat.com', 'username': 'russellb'}, {'_account_id': 4395, 'name': 'Aaron Rosen', 'email': 'aaronorosen@gmail.com', 'username': 'arosen'}, {'_account_id': 8410, 'name': 'Richard Theis', 'email': 'rtheis@us.ibm.com', 'username': 'rtheis'}, {'_account_id': 9515, 'name': 'Matthew Kassawara', 'email': 'mkassawara@gmail.com', 'username': 'ionosphere80'}, {'_account_id': 11682, 'name': 'Ryan Moats', 'email': 'rmoats@us.ibm.com', 'username': 'regXboi'}, {'_account_id': 17595, 'name': 'Amitabha Biswas', 'email': 'azbiswas@gmail.com', 'username': 'azbiswas'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-03-29 16:25:47.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/install.rst', 'devstack/plugin.sh'], 'message': 'Start ovn-northd in the devstack screen as a foreground process

A side-effect of separate ovsdb-server processors handling NB and SB
for default devstack (https://review.openstack.org/#/c/276364/) is
the use of ovn-ctl start_northd command to spawn the ovn-northd
process. The functionality of the devstack setup is correct, but in
the screen associated with the ovn-northd process, the output seen
is the following:

>> & echo $! >/opt/stack/status/stack/ovn-northd.pid; fg || \
     echo "ovn-northd failed to start" | \
     tee "/opt/stack/status/stack/ovn-northd.failure"
bash: syntax error near unexpected token `&'
>>

The ovn-northd process is actually spawned correctly and can be seen
in the output of ps. The start_northd creates ovn-northd as a daemon
and as a result the screen associated with ovn-northd doesn't have
a handle to the process.

This patch starts the ovn-northd as a foreground process in the
devstack screen. It also provides some simple command line options
associated with start_northd command in the documentation for a
non-devstack use case.

Change-Id: Ib5921fb7ba9efa0b5cf4cc8c99897473628dfae9
'}]
commit_message:
Start ovn-northd in the devstack screen as a foreground process

A side-effect of separate ovsdb-server processors handling NB and SB
for default devstack (https://review.openstack.org/#/c/276364/) is
the use of ovn-ctl start_northd command to spawn the ovn-northd
process. The functionality of the devstack setup is correct, but in
the screen associated with the ovn-northd process, the output seen
is the following:

>> & echo $! >/opt/stack/status/stack/ovn-northd.pid; fg || \
     echo "ovn-northd failed to start" | \
     tee "/opt/stack/status/stack/ovn-northd.failure"
bash: syntax error near unexpected token `&'
>>

The ovn-northd process is actually spawned correctly and can be seen
in the output of ps. The start_northd creates ovn-northd as a daemon
and as a result the screen associated with ovn-northd doesn't have
a handle to the process.

This patch starts the ovn-northd as a foreground process in the
devstack screen. It also provides some simple command line options
associated with start_northd command in the documentation for a
non-devstack use case.

Change-Id: Ib5921fb7ba9efa0b5cf4cc8c99897473628dfae9

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1923, 'name': 'Mohammad Banikazemi', 'email': 'mbanikazemi@gmail.com', 'username': 'mb-s'}, {'_account_id': 6598, 'name': 'Berezovsky Irena', 'email': 'irenab.dev@gmail.com', 'username': 'irenab'}, {'_account_id': 11343, 'name': 'Gal Sagie', 'email': 'gal.sagie@gmail.com', 'username': 'GalSagie'}, {'_account_id': 12069, 'name': 'Taku Fukushima', 'email': 'f.tac.mac@gmail.com', 'username': 'tfukushima'}, {'_account_id': 14352, 'name': 'Antoni Segura Puimedon', 'email': 'celebdor@gmail.com', 'username': 'toni'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-03-30 03:03:02.000000000', 'files': ['kuryr/tests/unit/test_kuryr_network.py', 'kuryr/tests/unit/test_kuryr_existing_network.py', 'kuryr/tests/unit/base.py', 'kuryr/tests/unit/test_kuryr.py', 'kuryr/common/constants.py', 'kuryr/controllers.py'], 'message': 'Support for existing Neutron nets

An existing Neutron network can be specified as the network
being used for a Docker network being created. The Neutron
network id or name can be specified.

If a Docker network is deleted, the corresponding pre existing
Neutron network will not be deleted.

Usage:
 docker network create -d kuryr --ipam-driver=kuryr
     --subnet=10.10.0.0/24 --gateway=10.10.0.1
     -o neutron.net.uuid=d98d1259-03d1-4b45-9b86-b039cba1d90d mynet

 docker network create -d kuryr --ipam-driver=kuryr
     --subnet=10.10.0.0/24 --gateway=10.10.0.1
     -o neutron.net.name=my_neutron_net mynet

If subnet being specified does not exist, it will be created by
Kuryr. If exists it will be used.

Blueprint existing-neutron-network

Change-Id: I570aa4e77c906d3f04768e882f02050cd0cad558
'}]
commit_message:
Support for existing Neutron nets

An existing Neutron network can be specified as the network
being used for a Docker network being created. The Neutron
network id or name can be specified.

If a Docker network is deleted, the corresponding pre existing
Neutron network will not be deleted.

Usage:
 docker network create -d kuryr --ipam-driver=kuryr
     --subnet=10.10.0.0/24 --gateway=10.10.0.1
     -o neutron.net.uuid=d98d1259-03d1-4b45-9b86-b039cba1d90d mynet

 docker network create -d kuryr --ipam-driver=kuryr
     --subnet=10.10.0.0/24 --gateway=10.10.0.1
     -o neutron.net.name=my_neutron_net mynet

If subnet being specified does not exist, it will be created by
Kuryr. If exists it will be used.

Blueprint existing-neutron-network

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-03-29 06:25:03.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/functional/agent/linux/test_keepalived.py', 'neutron/agent/linux/keepalived.py'], 'message': 'Remove obsolete keepalived PID files before start

keepalived refuses to start and claims "daemon already started"
when there is already a process with the same PID as found in
either the VRRP or the main process PID file. This happens even
in case when the new process is not keepalived. The situation
can happen when the neutron node is reset and the obsolete PID
files are not cleaned before neutron is started.

This commit adds PID file cleanup before keepalived start.

Closes-Bug: 1561046
Change-Id: Ib6b6f2fe76fe82253f195c9eab6b243d9eb76fa2
'}]
commit_message:
Remove obsolete keepalived PID files before start

keepalived refuses to start and claims "daemon already started"
when there is already a process with the same PID as found in
either the VRRP or the main process PID file. This happens even
in case when the new process is not keepalived. The situation
can happen when the neutron node is reset and the obsolete PID
files are not cleaned before neutron is started.

This commit adds PID file cleanup before keepalived start.

Closes-Bug: 1561046
Change-Id: Ib6b6f2fe76fe82253f195c9eab6b243d9eb76fa2

commit_message:
create api-ref publishing pipeline

This creates most of the api-ref publishing pipeline along the lines
of api-guide. It's designed to support the new initiative to get API
docs into RST and back into project trees directly.

Also make nova patches ignore api-ref for the same things that
api-guide was ignored for.

Change-Id: I3265398fe46b04330401ca60391c105fd5d837fc

commit_message:
OpenStack services should reach Glance via the internal LB VIP

api_servers is now the preferred config option for Glance clients
in OpenStack services like Cinder and Nova. See:
https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/master/nova/image/glance.py#L48
for an example.

Change-Id: I236be9edd95cc07766823f1ca53f2790705b510a

commit_message:
Adjust swift plays to use unified os-swift role

In https://review.openstack.org/#/c/293536 os-swift-sync was merged into
os-swift. The playbooks in openstack-ansible need to be adjusted to set
the specific vars so that only the required tasks are run.

In order to speed up the gate run, we adjust the os-swift-install task
to run the os-swift role once, but have the same end result as before.

Change-Id: I3e3891333229be0fb933479837a2fca451eb7474
Depends-On: If01d8a3aa29fc7637aecb92e61929523af08103d

subject: Fix pep8 stderr warning regarding __all__ defined as list
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-28 18:02:45.000000000', 'files': ['ironicclient/__init__.py'], 'message': 'Fix pep8 stderr warning regarding __all__ defined as list

During the pep8 run get the following warning generated:

./ironicclient/__init__.py WARNING: __all__ is defined as a list, this
means pep257 cannot reliably detect contents of the __all__ variable,
because it can be mutated. Change __all__ to be an (immutable) tuple, to
remove this warning. Note, pep257 uses __all__ to detect which
definitions are public, to warn if public definitions are missing
docstrings. If __all__ is a (mutable) list, pep257 cannot reliably
assume its contents. pep257 will proceed assuming __all__ is not
mutated.

Change-Id: I25a5d24e9c429bdd119abf9efb24e3cc822eef4a
'}]
commit_message:
Fix pep8 stderr warning regarding __all__ defined as list

During the pep8 run get the following warning generated:

./ironicclient/__init__.py WARNING: __all__ is defined as a list, this
means pep257 cannot reliably detect contents of the __all__ variable,
because it can be mutated. Change __all__ to be an (immutable) tuple, to
remove this warning. Note, pep257 uses __all__ to detect which
definitions are public, to warn if public definitions are missing
docstrings. If __all__ is a (mutable) list, pep257 cannot reliably
assume its contents. pep257 will proceed assuming __all__ is not
mutated.

Change-Id: I25a5d24e9c429bdd119abf9efb24e3cc822eef4a

subject: Fix config and param data handling for Deploy VNF
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-03-30 02:29:07.000000000', 'files': ['tacker_horizon/openstack_dashboard/dashboards/nfv/vnfmanager/forms.py'], 'message': 'Fix config and param data handling for Deploy VNF

Config and param values are set in vnf arg and initialized to None
values even though param/config files are not provided.

This throws an exception in Heat Translator code for Tosca templates
when it tries to iterate over parsed_params which has None value.

Change-Id: I564405cd1d9e8819ee8ad391e910e30895fb0d94
Closes-Bug: #1563597
'}]
commit_message:
Fix config and param data handling for Deploy VNF

Config and param values are set in vnf arg and initialized to None
values even though param/config files are not provided.

This throws an exception in Heat Translator code for Tosca templates
when it tries to iterate over parsed_params which has None value.

Change-Id: I564405cd1d9e8819ee8ad391e910e30895fb0d94
Closes-Bug: #1563597

commit_message:
Add a vnic type for PF passthrough and a new libvirt vif driver

The new vnic type is defined by Neutron in the following change:

If1ab969c2002c649a3d51635ca2765c262e2d37f

We define it for Nova with this patch, and add a vif driver for plugging PFs -
it's really just a simple hostdev passthrough, which is already used so
we just abstract the code a bit.

The patch that same vif type to Neutron (it got overlooked by the
original work) is here:

https://review.openstack.org/262604

Change-Id: I1dc5601027ac97158d409d799b314a0c49968ce5
Related-blueprint: sriov-pf-passthrough-neutron-port

commit_message:
Missing Response Parameters table of "GET /v2.0/tenants"

This patch adds Response Parameter tables to the api-site documentation as
below:
 + tenants: One or more tenants objects.
 + id: the tenant ID.
 + name: the tenant name.
 + description: Description about the tenant.
 + enabled: Indicates whether the tenant is enabled or disabled.
 + tenants_links: Links of the tenants.

Change-Id: I007b5ff9813fc73390c5d75288ac62f621c7e7a3
Co-Authored-by: Cao Xuan Hoang <hoangcx@vn.fujitsu.com>
Closes-Bug: #1549215

subject: Allow gunicorn workers 5 min. to process requests
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-30 01:01:12.000000000', 'files': ['ansible/templates/gunicorn.j2'], 'message': 'Allow gunicorn workers 5 min. to process requests

Config updates can be time consuming, especially in testing environments
that utilize virt-on-virt.  Rather than timing out workers that are taking
a long time to process an update, bump the timeout to 5 minutes and allow
the requesting orchestrator to time out its request at shorter deadlines
instead.

Change-Id: Ibee73d7a43864da645b5d7198a5df2f2bf936ea9
(cherry picked from commit 179d7237476803b56cd380ea8b5e12ae3b6a5aba)
'}]
commit_message:
Allow gunicorn workers 5 min. to process requests

Config updates can be time consuming, especially in testing environments
that utilize virt-on-virt.  Rather than timing out workers that are taking
a long time to process an update, bump the timeout to 5 minutes and allow
the requesting orchestrator to time out its request at shorter deadlines
instead.

Change-Id: Ibee73d7a43864da645b5d7198a5df2f2bf936ea9
(cherry picked from commit 179d7237476803b56cd380ea8b5e12ae3b6a5aba)

commit_message:
Unset executable bit in release note

One of the release notes YAMLs was added with executable bit. YAML isn't
really executable, so this patch unsets it.

TrivialFix

Change-Id: I736f4fa603d3ed3fc878a4369de6e4be7662c8c7

subject: Remove console expectation from NMI tests
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-30 00:05:29.000000000', 'files': ['novaclient/tests/functional/v2/test_trigger_crash_dump.py'], 'message': 'Remove console expectation from NMI tests

The original tests expect the server console contains a message
  "Uhhuh. NMI received for unknown reason"
but the expectation is wrong because this message is fallback one
when disabling crash dump, that means the test expects the crash
dump is disable. That is not the purpose of this NMI feature.

In addition, this message is output on x86 cpu architecture only
because the message is implemented in
  https://github.com/torvalds/linux/blob/master/arch/x86/kernel/nmi.c#L304
So if we use the other cpu architectures on the test, this test will
fail.

Let's remove the expectation from the tests.

Change-Id: I62fe2e00433fd216def25d99a2f20d17b988fb84
Closes-Bug: #1553597
(cherry picked from commit 471e08a4d41f9d1bcf4703b4a0c64731a94f2510)
'}]
commit_message:
Remove console expectation from NMI tests

The original tests expect the server console contains a message
  "Uhhuh. NMI received for unknown reason"
but the expectation is wrong because this message is fallback one
when disabling crash dump, that means the test expects the crash
dump is disable. That is not the purpose of this NMI feature.

In addition, this message is output on x86 cpu architecture only
because the message is implemented in
  https://github.com/torvalds/linux/blob/master/arch/x86/kernel/nmi.c#L304
So if we use the other cpu architectures on the test, this test will
fail.

Let's remove the expectation from the tests.

Change-Id: I62fe2e00433fd216def25d99a2f20d17b988fb84
Closes-Bug: #1553597
(cherry picked from commit 471e08a4d41f9d1bcf4703b4a0c64731a94f2510)

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-03-28 09:46:55.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_driver.py'], 'message': 'Fix detach SR-IOV when using LibvirtConfigGuestHostdevPCI

This patch fixes an issue which was introduced by this
change If3edc1965c01a077eb61984a442e0d778d870d75.
Usually the vif config is of type LibvirtConfigGuestInterface,
but some vif use LibvirtConfigGuestHostdevPCI config
(e.g.  the ib_hostdev). The difference is that
LibvirtConfigGuestInterface keeps the pci address in source_dev
while LibvirtConfigGuestHostdevPCI has domain, bus, slot and
function, instead of relying on the vif config type we can take the
pci address for the neutron port.

Closes-Bug: #1560860

Change-Id: I62a7ff16f1c9c5da923451520fbeeabb5cc0c5c6
'}]
commit_message:
Fix detach SR-IOV when using LibvirtConfigGuestHostdevPCI

This patch fixes an issue which was introduced by this
change If3edc1965c01a077eb61984a442e0d778d870d75.
Usually the vif config is of type LibvirtConfigGuestInterface,
but some vif use LibvirtConfigGuestHostdevPCI config
(e.g.  the ib_hostdev). The difference is that
LibvirtConfigGuestInterface keeps the pci address in source_dev
while LibvirtConfigGuestHostdevPCI has domain, bus, slot and
function, instead of relying on the vif config type we can take the
pci address for the neutron port.

Closes-Bug: #1560860

Change-Id: I62a7ff16f1c9c5da923451520fbeeabb5cc0c5c6

commit_message:
Huawei: Fix getting admin_metadata

initialize_connection() isn't converted to use
versioned objects yet, so Huawei driver is failing
to get admin_metadata. This commit fixes that and
adds LUN WWN check to extend_volume().

Closes-Bug: #1560478

commit_message:
devstack: Bump alive_timeout

Bump alive timeout to 60s to deal with slow qemu instances.

Also, give astara more time to recover from a degraded cluster. This
can be slow to recover when a slow qemu node is waiting on a long-running
config update.

Change-Id: I491b96c43d898f7a961725e4f5720af7b9547038

The following error occurs when you try to execute the docs target
locally:

Warning, treated as error:
<...>/doc/source/devref/quality_of_service.rst:340: ERROR: Unknown
target name: "http://unix.stackexchange.com/a/100797".

commit_message:
Fix docs tox target for local runs

The following error occurs when you try to execute the docs target
locally:

Warning, treated as error:
<...>/doc/source/devref/quality_of_service.rst:340: ERROR: Unknown
target name: "http://unix.stackexchange.com/a/100797".

It fails locally only, because in gate job, we don't treat warnings as
errors.

Change-Id: I6703be19d3458d036fdd1378fe6e85784ab54191

Fix consistently failing CentOS gate

with building images.  I'm not sure where the regression came from,
but I suspect a new verson of MySQL-python from pip is to blame.

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-03-14 15:50:54.000000000', 'files': ['neutron_lib/constants.py'], 'message': "New device owner flag for HA router interface

Currently HA router interface port uses DEVICE_OWNER_ROUTER_INTF as
device owner(like normal router interface). So to check if a port is
a HA router interface port, we have to perform a DB operation.

Neutron server at many places may need check if a port is HA router
interface port and perform different set of operations, then it has
to access DB for this. Instead of that, if this information is
available as port's device owner, we can avoid DB access every time.

Partial-Bug: #1554519
Change-Id: I89b247bdac3aee1e47ee8a1c9f1cb2c385019a51
"}]
commit_message:
New device owner flag for HA router interface

Currently HA router interface port uses DEVICE_OWNER_ROUTER_INTF as
device owner(like normal router interface). So to check if a port is
a HA router interface port, we have to perform a DB operation.

Neutron server at many places may need check if a port is HA router
interface port and perform different set of operations, then it has
to access DB for this. Instead of that, if this information is
available as port's device owner, we can avoid DB access every time.

Partial-Bug: #1554519
Change-Id: I89b247bdac3aee1e47ee8a1c9f1cb2c385019a51

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-29 22:08:47.000000000', 'files': ['astara/test/functional/base.py', 'devstack/plugin.sh', 'astara/test/functional/test_tenant_router.py'], 'message': 'Fix bugs in functional tests

Pulls in some fixes from master that address new issues that recently
started affecting our gate jobs.

Includes:

Fix bugs in functional tests

- Dont cache management address of appliances
- Wait for nova instance status==active before asserting router status
- Wait a full config_timeout (600s) for rebuild
- Also look for ha router interfaces when cleaning up

Change-Id: I69341c6abee4e36b10f8e9b676587babe861f0c0

And:

devstack: Bump alive_timeout

Bump alive timeout to 60s to deal with slow qemu instances.

Also, give astara more time to recover from a degraded cluster. This
can be slow to recover when a slow qemu node is waiting on a long-running
config update.

Change-Id: I491b96c43d898f7a961725e4f5720af7b9547038
'}]
commit_message:
Fix bugs in functional tests

Pulls in some fixes from master that address new issues that recently
started affecting our gate jobs.

Includes:

Fix bugs in functional tests

- Dont cache management address of appliances
- Wait for nova instance status==active before asserting router status
- Wait a full config_timeout (600s) for rebuild
- Also look for ha router interfaces when cleaning up

Change-Id: I69341c6abee4e36b10f8e9b676587babe861f0c0

And:

devstack: Bump alive_timeout

Bump alive timeout to 60s to deal with slow qemu instances.

Also, give astara more time to recover from a degraded cluster. This
can be slow to recover when a slow qemu node is waiting on a long-running
config update.

Change-Id: I491b96c43d898f7a961725e4f5720af7b9547038

commit_message:
Fix full_trusty_build once and for all

After finally being able to test this locally, I've found that the
'cgroup-lite' package is what we were missing, not lxc.

Additionally, the output is written by root, not the current user, so
use sudo when modifying/writing files in imagebuild/coreos/UPLOAD.

Change-Id: I8cf5ce5bd5345ccea5e8869f2628f8616d0fe758
Closes-Bug: #1559383

revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-03-02 03:41:39.000000000', 'files': ['test/unit/account/test_reaper.py', 'swift/account/reaper.py'], 'message': "Fix account-reaper unable to delete all containers.

When reaper try to find the correct container_shard number,
but it doesn't compare local device's name, so it always
return first entry's index of local devices from the ring
to container_shard.
That causes some containers will be skip and objects under
these containers won't be delete.

Change-Id: I0e2bbdd99add86ee46e856920c0740c4aa13c77d
Closes-Bug: #1549615
"}]
commit_message:
Fix account-reaper unable to delete all containers.

When reaper try to find the correct container_shard number,
but it doesn't compare local device's name, so it always
return first entry's index of local devices from the ring
to container_shard.
That causes some containers will be skip and objects under
these containers won't be delete.

Change-Id: I0e2bbdd99add86ee46e856920c0740c4aa13c77d
Closes-Bug: #1549615

commit_message:
Change global requirements to exclude cliff version 1.16.0 and 1.17.0

1.16.0 uses fcntl which is not available on windows (See Bug #1543958).
1.17.0 does not work when an empty list is provided (See Bug #1539770).

There are no further releases in the 1.x series after 1.17.0 and the both
issues were addressed as of 2.0.0 so we should be fine with the
exclusion.

Conflicts:
	global-requirements.txt

Related-Bug: 1543958

commit_message:
DVR: rebind port if ofport changes

When binding is called in DVR, check to see if the port was
previously wired under a different ofport. If it was, first
unbind the old port and then bind the new one.

Change-Id: I372158c4a6986295e396d849a2c9c5372b271e08
Closes-Bug: #1562467

commit_message:
Opportunistic testing with different DBs

If there is a MySql or Postgresql database available that oslo.db
can connect to, run the migration tests using these databases.

OpenStack infra makes MySql and Postgresql databases available.

This will improve test coverage and ensure that the migrations
work on production databases.

Change-Id: Ic689fcb003b801db5b5afc64e7dd249f2f5c3dde

subject: Correct test_implied_roles_fk_on_delete_cascade
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2016-03-23 16:16:53.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/tests/unit/test_sql_upgrade.py'], 'message': "Correct test_implied_roles_fk_on_delete_cascade

This test was using the role_api to insert rows into and query the
database. The rows inserted into the database for migration tests
must be inserted directly because the driver is not necessarily
going to work with the old version of the database that's in use in
the test and the contents of the database could change and not match
what the old version of the code actually inserted.

Change-Id: I3e05e132139623c6323338c3ba5a0742542e7562
"}]
commit_message:
Correct test_implied_roles_fk_on_delete_cascade

This test was using the role_api to insert rows into and query the
database. The rows inserted into the database for migration tests
must be inserted directly because the driver is not necessarily
going to work with the old version of the database that's in use in
the test and the contents of the database could change and not match
what the old version of the code actually inserted.

Change-Id: I3e05e132139623c6323338c3ba5a0742542e7562

subject: Fix table row counting SQL for MySQL and Postgresql
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2016-03-23 16:16:53.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/tests/unit/test_sql_upgrade.py'], 'message': 'Fix table row counting SQL for MySQL and Postgresql

Several migration tests were failing when run on MySQL and
Postgresql with an SQL error:

  oslo_db.exception.DBError: (pymysql.err.InternalError)
  (1248, u'Every derived table must have its own alias') [SQL:
  u'SELECT count(id) AS tbl_row_count \nFROM (SELECT user.id AS
  id, user.extra AS extra, user.enabled AS enabled,
  user.default_project_id AS default_project_id \nFROM user)']

  oslo_db.exception.DBError: (psycopg2.ProgrammingError)
  subquery in FROM must have an alias
    LINE 2: FROM (SELECT "user".id AS id, "user".extra AS
    extra, "user"....
               ^
  HINT:  For example, FROM (SELECT ...) [AS] foo.
   [SQL: 'SELECT count(id) AS tbl_row_count \nFROM (SELECT
    "user".id AS id, "user".extra AS extra, "user".enabled AS
    enabled, "user".default_project_id AS default_project_id
    \nFROM "user")']

While this looks like a bug in sqlalchemy, there's no need for
keystone to be generating such complicated queries to get the
row count. It should just be `SELECT COUNT(*) FROM table`.

See http://docs.sqlalchemy.org/en/rel_1_0/orm/tutorial.html#counting

Change-Id: Ia49b50a4598656777409b51841c6c83598232c53
'}]
commit_message:
Fix table row counting SQL for MySQL and Postgresql

Several migration tests were failing when run on MySQL and
Postgresql with an SQL error:

  oslo_db.exception.DBError: (pymysql.err.InternalError)
  (1248, u'Every derived table must have its own alias') [SQL:
  u'SELECT count(id) AS tbl_row_count \nFROM (SELECT user.id AS
  id, user.extra AS extra, user.enabled AS enabled,
  user.default_project_id AS default_project_id \nFROM user)']

  oslo_db.exception.DBError: (psycopg2.ProgrammingError)
  subquery in FROM must have an alias
    LINE 2: FROM (SELECT "user".id AS id, "user".extra AS
    extra, "user"....
               ^
  HINT:  For example, FROM (SELECT ...) [AS] foo.
   [SQL: 'SELECT count(id) AS tbl_row_count \nFROM (SELECT
    "user".id AS id, "user".extra AS extra, "user".enabled AS
    enabled, "user".default_project_id AS default_project_id
    \nFROM "user")']

While this looks like a bug in sqlalchemy, there's no need for
keystone to be generating such complicated queries to get the
row count. It should just be `SELECT COUNT(*) FROM table`.

See http://docs.sqlalchemy.org/en/rel_1_0/orm/tutorial.html#counting

Change-Id: Ia49b50a4598656777409b51841c6c83598232c53

subject: Switch migration tests to oslo.db DbTestCase
revisions:
[{'number': 9, 'created': '2016-03-23 16:16:53.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/tests/unit/test_sql_livetest.py', 'keystone/tests/unit/config_files/backend_postgresql.conf', 'test-requirements.txt', 'keystone/common/sql/core.py', 'keystone/tests/unit/config_files/backend_db2.conf', 'keystone/tests/unit/config_files/backend_mysql.conf', 'keystone/tests/unit/ksfixtures/database.py', 'keystone/tests/unit/test_sql_upgrade.py'], 'message': "Switch migration tests to oslo.db DbTestCase

oslo.db provides a DbTestCase base class that configures the oslo.db
for in-memory sqlite testing, in addition to being able to test
against other live databases.

Any support that we may have had for live database testing is
removed. It will be added back in a later patch to use features of
oslo.db DbTestCase to implement OpenStack's common way to do
live database testing.

Change-Id: I5b691d0adc812d687b318f639544ecaa165b9cfc
"}]
commit_message:
Switch migration tests to oslo.db DbTestCase

oslo.db provides a DbTestCase base class that configures the oslo.db
for in-memory sqlite testing, in addition to being able to test
against other live databases.

Any support that we may have had for live database testing is
removed. It will be added back in a later patch to use features of
oslo.db DbTestCase to implement OpenStack's common way to do
live database testing.

Change-Id: I5b691d0adc812d687b318f639544ecaa165b9cfc

subject: collector: never allow to lose data
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-29 15:52:45.000000000', 'files': ['ceilometer/collector.py', 'ceilometer/tests/functional/test_collector.py', 'releasenotes/notes/always-requeue-7a2df9243987ab67.yaml'], 'message': 'collector: never allow to lose data

The current default allows to lose data very easily: if the dispatcher
fails to send data to the backend (e.g. Gnocchi is down), then the
dispatcher raises and the data are lost for ever. This is completely
unacceptable, and nobody should be able to configure Ceilometer in that
way.

This patch entirely remove that option, and switch the behavior to
something sane.

Change-Id: I45cb3da84eb2a785f46b3ec676c1a052ce999206
(cherry picked from commit 40684dafae76eab77b66bb1da7e143a3d7e2c9c8)
'}]
commit_message:
collector: never allow to lose data

The current default allows to lose data very easily: if the dispatcher
fails to send data to the backend (e.g. Gnocchi is down), then the
dispatcher raises and the data are lost for ever. This is completely
unacceptable, and nobody should be able to configure Ceilometer in that
way.

This patch entirely remove that option, and switch the behavior to
something sane.

Change-Id: I45cb3da84eb2a785f46b3ec676c1a052ce999206
(cherry picked from commit 40684dafae76eab77b66bb1da7e143a3d7e2c9c8)

subject: Remove console expectation from NMI tests
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-05 21:47:58.000000000', 'files': ['novaclient/tests/functional/v2/test_trigger_crash_dump.py'], 'message': 'Remove console expectation from NMI tests

The original tests expect the server console contains a message
  "Uhhuh. NMI received for unknown reason"
but the expectation is wrong because this message is fallback one
when disabling crash dump, that means the test expects the crash
dump is disable. That is not the purpose of this NMI feature.

In addition, this message is output on x86 cpu architecture only
because the message is implemented in
  https://github.com/torvalds/linux/blob/master/arch/x86/kernel/nmi.c#L304
So if we use the other cpu architectures on the test, this test will
fail.

Let's remove the expectation from the tests.

Change-Id: I62fe2e00433fd216def25d99a2f20d17b988fb84
Closes-Bug: #1553597
'}]
commit_message:
Remove console expectation from NMI tests

The original tests expect the server console contains a message
  "Uhhuh. NMI received for unknown reason"
but the expectation is wrong because this message is fallback one
when disabling crash dump, that means the test expects the crash
dump is disable. That is not the purpose of this NMI feature.

In addition, this message is output on x86 cpu architecture only
because the message is implemented in
  https://github.com/torvalds/linux/blob/master/arch/x86/kernel/nmi.c#L304
So if we use the other cpu architectures on the test, this test will
fail.

Let's remove the expectation from the tests.

Change-Id: I62fe2e00433fd216def25d99a2f20d17b988fb84
Closes-Bug: #1553597

commit_message:
Fix typo in Pure block storage config reference

There was a mention of Storage Center which was a copy-paste remnant of
the replication configuration (which is common for a few Cinder
drivers). We just need to change it to say Flash Array instead.

Closes-Bug: #1563457

revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2016-03-17 19:32:30.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/advanced_deployment/advanced_deployment.rst', 'doc/source/advanced_deployment/node_placement.rst'], 'message': 'Document using node capabilities to control placement

In addition to the per-role profile matching and manual tagging,
some operators wish to enforce placement to specific nodes, known
prior to deployment.  This is now possible via the *SchedulerHints
parameters, so document how in more detail than the t-h-t commit
message.

Co-authored-by Ryan Hallisey <rhallise@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By Ben Nemec <bnemec@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I26795e5a35f351ca95796c567526095671abc428
'}]
commit_message:
Document using node capabilities to control placement

In addition to the per-role profile matching and manual tagging,
some operators wish to enforce placement to specific nodes, known
prior to deployment.  This is now possible via the *SchedulerHints
parameters, so document how in more detail than the t-h-t commit
message.

Co-authored-by Ryan Hallisey <rhallise@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By Ben Nemec <bnemec@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I26795e5a35f351ca95796c567526095671abc428

commit_message:
Update list of pkgs in includepkgs

This change updates the list of packages installed from
delorean-current so that it matches those installed by tripleo.sh,
previously images would not include -current version of:

  - os-apply-config
  - os-collect-config
  - openstack-tripleo
  - openstack-tripleo-puppet-elements

To sync with the tripleo.sh behaviour we also remove the following
from the list of those installed by -current:

  - openstack-heat
  - openstack-ironic
  - openstack-ironic-inspector
  - openstack-tuskar-ui-extras
  - python-ironic-inspector-client

Change-Id: I048bc41bcf5aae9efdb233361d48a3075c1bab2d

commit_message:
Add PROJECTS var to reproduce.sh

Some devstack-gate runs don't use a default PROJECTS list, record the
PROJECTS list that was used in the reproduce script to avoid error on
clone errors with devstack.

commit_message:
Change log level for permission denied on certain process checks.

Right now we log a warning and we do not believe it should be that
high. Also fixed up the documentation for this and removing some
process checks we do not gather anymore

When we do get permission denied when trying to grab metrics we
now do not report any measurement. We used to report 0.

Change-Id: I64102f618ce2293590c6b516b050643a73fdd382

== is for value equality
"is" is for reference equality

Change-Id: Ibb63c6675974259981bb92c3aa17945b25e631c3
'}]
commit_message:
Fix Agent Restarting Issue with Changing is to ==

== is for value equality
"is" is for reference equality
During testing in padawan, agent was always restarting
even there were no changes and turned out misusing "is"
was the problem.

Change-Id: Ibb63c6675974259981bb92c3aa17945b25e631c3

commit_message:
Fix bugs in functional tests

- Dont cache management address of appliances
- Wait for nova instance status==active before asserting router status
- Wait a full config_timeout (600s) for rebuild
- Also look for ha router interfaces when cleaning up

Change-Id: I69341c6abee4e36b10f8e9b676587babe861f0c0
(cherry picked from commit f4cfb48080d9e63a13c0c8e42a73f69d859d11f3)

subject: Re-indexing optimization for doc_type
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-29 20:55:20.000000000', 'files': ['searchlight/elasticsearch/plugins/utils.py', 'searchlight/cmd/manage.py'], 'message': 'Re-indexing optimization for doc_type

When the user calls the "index sync" command and specifies a
document type (i.e. OS::Nova::Server) we will go to all plugins
and have them re-index. Instead only the specified doc type(s)
should re-index through their plugins. The other doc types should
be transferred using internal ElasticSearch functionality, like
the Helper reindex method. If no type is specified we will reindex
through the plugins.

Change-Id: Ida85002c306a52ccb6b5ec73a3dbe021bca333bc
Closes-Bug: #1558618
(cherry picked from commit cb2137bd23f112ff6cb64c13eb9a76f36eb3c9c8)
'}]
commit_message:
Re-indexing optimization for doc_type

When the user calls the "index sync" command and specifies a
document type (i.e. OS::Nova::Server) we will go to all plugins
and have them re-index. Instead only the specified doc type(s)
should re-index through their plugins. The other doc types should
be transferred using internal ElasticSearch functionality, like
the Helper reindex method. If no type is specified we will reindex
through the plugins.

Change-Id: Ida85002c306a52ccb6b5ec73a3dbe021bca333bc
Closes-Bug: #1558618
(cherry picked from commit cb2137bd23f112ff6cb64c13eb9a76f36eb3c9c8)

commit_message:
port security: gracefully handle resources with no bindings

Resources could be created before the extension was enabled in the
setup. In that case, no bindings are created for them. In that case, we
should gracefully return default (True) value when extracting the value
using the mixin; and we should also create binding model on update
request, if there is no existing binding model for the resource.

While at it, introduced a constant to store the default value for port
security (True) and changed several tests to use the constant instead of
extracting it from extension resource map.

Change-Id: I8607cdecdc16c5f94635c94e2f02700c732806eb
Closes-Bug: #1509312

subject: Don't restart Pacemaker-managed services from Puppet
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-29 15:49:45.000000000', 'files': ['puppet/manifests/overcloud_controller_pacemaker.pp'], 'message': "Don't restart Pacemaker-managed services from Puppet

We need to reload/restart services on updates/upgrades to apply any
config changes, but restarting services managed from Pacemaker from
Puppet causes problems.

For now we no-op the restart and rely on the catch-all restart after
Puppet phase.

In the future we should have a service provider for pacemaker resources
that will be using pcs. We still might have to restart services outside
Puppet due to cluster-wide orchestration issues, but we might be able to
do the restarts selectively rather than restart everything.

We also no-op the start/stop commands to be safe, as it also doesn't
make sense for Puppet to try start and stop those services when it
doesn't have knowledge about Pacemaker.

Change-Id: I95e21e10471cd7575f28c095c48150325f1414b3
Closes-Bug: #1562922
(cherry picked from commit 7b2e56053f6cf7535c7ae416c5cb41e7c9679924)
"}]
commit_message:
Don't restart Pacemaker-managed services from Puppet

We need to reload/restart services on updates/upgrades to apply any
config changes, but restarting services managed from Pacemaker from
Puppet causes problems.

For now we no-op the restart and rely on the catch-all restart after
Puppet phase.

In the future we should have a service provider for pacemaker resources
that will be using pcs. We still might have to restart services outside
Puppet due to cluster-wide orchestration issues, but we might be able to
do the restarts selectively rather than restart everything.

We also no-op the start/stop commands to be safe, as it also doesn't
make sense for Puppet to try start and stop those services when it
doesn't have knowledge about Pacemaker.

Change-Id: I95e21e10471cd7575f28c095c48150325f1414b3
Closes-Bug: #1562922
(cherry picked from commit 7b2e56053f6cf7535c7ae416c5cb41e7c9679924)

commit_message:
XtremIO handle errors in terminate_connection:

* Handle non-standard initiator group names - discover initiator group from
  initiator port address (wwwpn or iqn).
* Don't hide errors on invalid volume and target group.
* Fix relevant tests.
* Add test for failure during terminate_connection.

liberty-backport-potential
mitaka-backport-potential


Change-Id: I4f83164ac8afc58a8afe391cc684bdb4b270da45
Closes-Bug: #1551253
(cherry picked from commit fb68584b9a7b61664328017c25c72ce295b4c8a6)

commit_message:
Brings openstack-pkg-tools to current.

This commit brings the package from the OpenStack namespace
up to the current version in Debian for Mitaka.

It also adds pkgos-infra-build-pkg and pkgos-infra-install-sbuild
so that OpenStack infra can build packages.

Change-Id: If591352ea01e52e15f6edb7d07ad127a5b5e8519
